title: Historical grammar of the Neapolitan dialect
abstractText: The project sets out to describe, compare and analyse a broad range of phonological and, in particular, morph syntactic structure in the various historical stages of the Neapolitan dialect, a previously little-studied Romance variety, bringing together traditional philological and dialectological scholarship with the state-of-the-are in linguistic analysis. The final output of the project will be a one-volume monograph tracing the phonological and morph syntactic development of Neapolitan from the 13th century to the present-day, together with a number of accompanying journal article reporting on, and developing further where relevant, particular findings presented in the monograph.
